files.README.md:
# AI Elements Skill for Claude Code

A Claude Code plugin marketplace providing intelligent documentation and implementation support for the AI Elements component library.

## Overview

This marketplace contains a specialized skill that provides context-aware documentation retrieval for AI Elements - a comprehensive library of AI-native UI components built on top of shadcn/ui. The skill automatically activates when you mention AI Elements component names (like Message, Conversation, Reasoning, Canvas, etc.) and provides smart documentation fetching based on your query context.

## Installation

To add this marketplace to your Claude Code installation:

```bash
/plugin marketplace add nathanonn/claude-skills-ai-elements
```

After adding the marketplace, the `ai-elements` skill will be available for installation and will automatically activate when working with AI-native applications.

## Available Plugins

### ai-elements

**Type:** Project Skill (Managed)

**Description:** Intelligent documentation system for AI Elements component library with automatic activation and context-aware documentation retrieval.

**Features:**

-   Automatic activation when AI Elements component names are mentioned
-   Context-aware documentation fetching:
    -   Examples for implementation queries
    -   Component references for API lookups
    -   Smart multi-page fetching for complex tasks
-   Comprehensive coverage of 31+ components
-   Implementation patterns and best practices
-   Troubleshooting guides

**Components Covered:**

-   Core: Message, Conversation, Reasoning, Canvas
-   Messaging: MessageList, MessageInput, MessageActions
-   Interactive: Copilot, ExpandableSection, InlineCompletion
-   Display: CardList, ContentDisplay, InteractiveHighlight
-   And 25+ more components

## Usage

Once installed, the skill automatically provides documentation when you:

-   Mention AI Elements component names in your queries
-   Request implementation examples
-   Ask for component API references
-   Work on AI-native application development

Example queries that will activate the skill:

-   "How do I implement the Message component?"
-   "Show me examples of using Conversation"
-   "What props does the Reasoning component accept?"
-   "Help me build a chatbot with AI Elements"

## Prerequisites

-   Claude Code CLI installed and configured
-   Basic familiarity with React and TypeScript (for implementation)
-   Understanding of shadcn/ui components (recommended)

## Repository Structure

```
.claude/
└── skills/
    └── ai-elements/
        ├── SKILL.md              # Skill definition and metadata
        ├── INDEX.md              # Searchable component reference
        └── docs/
            ├── README.md         # Overview and categories
            ├── introduction.md   # Getting started guide
            ├── usage.md          # Implementation patterns
            ├── troubleshooting.md# Common issues and solutions
            ├── components/       # 31 component docs
            └── examples/         # Tutorial files
```

## Development

To test this marketplace locally:

```bash
/plugin marketplace add ./path/to/claude-skills-ai-elements
```

## Support

For issues, questions, or contributions, please visit:

-   Repository: https://github.com/nathanonn/claude-skills-ai-elements
-   Contact: hello@nathanonn.com

## License

MIT License - see LICENSE file for details

## About AI Elements

AI Elements is a comprehensive library of AI-native UI components designed to help developers build sophisticated AI interfaces quickly. Built as an extension of shadcn/ui, it provides components specifically designed for AI interactions, conversations, reasoning displays, and more.

marketplaces.name: implementation-plan-generator-marketplace
marketplaces.description: Generate phased implementation plans from requirements and UI wireframes. Use when the user provides requirements documents and/or UI wireframes and wants to create a detailed, phased implementation plan. Triggers on requests like 'create implementation plan', 'plan the implementation', or when asked to design an implementation approach for a project. Produces description-only plans (no code) with clear phases, dependencies, and testing checklists.

files.README.md:
# Implementation Plan Generator Skill for Claude Code

A Claude Code plugin marketplace providing a skill that generates structured, phased implementation plans from requirements documents and UI wireframes.

## Overview

This marketplace contains a specialized skill that transforms requirements and wireframes into detailed implementation plans. The skill automatically activates when you request implementation planning (e.g., "create implementation plan", "plan the implementation") and produces description-only plans with clear phases, dependencies, and testing checklists.

## Installation

To add this marketplace to your Claude Code installation:

```bash
/plugin marketplace add nathanonn/claude-skills-implementation-plan-generator
```

After adding the marketplace, the `implementation-plan-generator` skill will be available for installation.

## Available Plugins

### implementation-plan-generator

**Type:** Project Skill (Managed)

**Description:** Generates phased implementation plans from requirements documents and UI wireframes with dependency tracking and testing checklists.

**Features:**

- Automatic activation on implementation planning requests
- Phased approach with logical ordering:
  - Foundation phases (data models, core infrastructure)
  - Domain logic phases (business logic, validation)
  - API/Backend phases (routes, integrations)
  - UI/Frontend phases (pages, components)
  - Integration phases (logging, reporting)
- Dependency mapping and critical path identification
- Description-only output (no implementation code)
- Testing checklists for each phase
- ASCII dependency graphs

**Inputs:**

- Requirements document (features, business rules, user roles)
- UI wireframes/specifications (pages, components, interactions) - optional but recommended

**Outputs:**

- `index.md` - Overview, phase table, dependency graph, key files
- `phase-XX-name.md` - Individual phase files with detailed specifications

## Usage

Once installed, the skill activates when you:

- Request an implementation plan for a project
- Provide requirements documents and ask for planning
- Ask to design an implementation approach
- Want to break down a project into phases

Example queries that will activate the skill:

- "Create an implementation plan for this project"
- "Plan the implementation based on these requirements"
- "Design an implementation approach for this feature"
- "Break down this project into development phases"

## Prerequisites

- Claude Code CLI installed and configured
- Requirements document or project specifications
- UI wireframes (optional but recommended for frontend projects)

## Repository Structure

```
.claude/
└── skills/
    └── implementation-plan-generator/
        ├── SKILL.md              # Skill definition and workflow
        └── references/
            ├── index-template.md  # Template for plan index
            └── phase-template.md  # Template for phase files
```

## Output Structure

The skill generates a structured plan directory:

```
implementation-plan/
├── index.md              # Overview with phase summary and dependency graph
├── phase-01-data-models.md
├── phase-02-auth-integration.md
├── phase-03-api-routes.md
├── phase-04-user-dashboard.md
└── phase-05-reporting.md
```

## Phase Types

The skill supports different phase types with specialized templates:

- **Database/Model Phases** - Field tables, relations, constraints, migration notes
- **API/Backend Phases** - Routes, request/response interfaces, validation, authorization
- **UI/Frontend Phases** - Page routes, ASCII wireframes, component props, client-side logic
- **Integration Phases** - Data flows, event handlers, external system connections

## Development

To test this marketplace locally:

```bash
/plugin marketplace add ./path/to/claude-skills-implementation-plan-generator
```

## Support

For issues, questions, or contributions, please visit:

- Repository: https://github.com/nathanonn/claude-skills-implementation-plan-generator
- Contact: hello@nathanonn.com

## License

MIT License - see LICENSE file for details
